page.title: 05Godinton Park
page.content: The mediaeval house at Godinton was owned by the Goldwell family.The Toke family took over the house from the Goldwells in the 1480's.The house was altered and extended by Nicholas Toke in 1627 and has changed very little since 1630. The house contains many rooms in which there is carved wood panelling.There are many pieces of valuable antique furniture and collections of antique china. In the early 19th. century John Toke laid out a formal pleasure garden which has been preserved inside a continous yew hedge,planted in 1904. The Toke family owned the house and estate until 1896.It now belongs to Mr.Alan Wyndham Green. Part of the old Godinton Park was sold for the building of the new Godinton Park housing estate.
